vn.uiza.views.overscroll.lib.overscroll.adapters

Class HorizontalScrollViewOverScrollDecorAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • vn.uiza.views.overscroll.lib.overscroll.adapters.HorizontalScrollViewOverScrollDecorAdapter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IOverScrollDecoratorAdapter

    public class HorizontalScrollViewOverScrollDecorAdapter
extends java.lang.Object
implements IOverScrollDecoratorAdapter
    An adapter that enables over-scrolling support over a HorizontalScrollView.
    Seeing that HorizontalScrollView only supports horizontal scrolling, this adapter should only be used with a HorizontalOverScrollBounceEffectDecorator.
    See Also:
    HorizontalOverScrollBounceEffectDecorator, VerticalOverScrollBounceEffectDecorator

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      android.view.View getView() 
      boolean isInAbsoluteEnd()
      Is view in it's absolute end position - such that an over-scroll can potentially be initiated.
      boolean isInAbsoluteStart()
      Is view in it's absolute start position - such that a negative over-scroll can potentially be initiated.

      • getView

        public android.view.View getView()
        Specified by:

      • isInAbsoluteStart

        public boolean isInAbsoluteStart()
        Description copied from interface: IOverScrollDecoratorAdapter
        Is view in it's absolute start position - such that a negative over-scroll can potentially be initiated. For example, in list-views, this is synonymous with the first item being fully visible.
        Specified by:
        isInAbsoluteStart in interface IOverScrollDecoratorAdapter
        Returns:
        Whether in absolute start position.

      • isInAbsoluteEnd

        public boolean isInAbsoluteEnd()
        Description copied from interface: IOverScrollDecoratorAdapter
        Is view in it's absolute end position - such that an over-scroll can potentially be initiated. For example, in list-views, this is synonymous with the last item being fully visible.
        Specified by:
        isInAbsoluteEnd in interface IOverScrollDecoratorAdapter
        Returns:
        Whether in absolute end position.
